discoveredAssets: localhost:5000 - Flask-based loan management web application (Werkzeug 3.1.3, Python 3.13.3) - Port 5000
/login - Authentication endpoint (GET/POST form-based auth) - Testing credentials exposed: test:test
/home - Authenticated dashboard - Displays user welcome and loan information
/profile - User profile management (GET/POST) - Editable fields: name, lastname, email, loan_amount, loan_term_months, monthly_payment
/loan_details - Loan information display with dynamic amortization table loader
/amortization - Amortization table generator - Accepts 'term' parameter, feature marked as not fully implemented
/static/ - Static assets (Bootstrap CSS, jQuery, Bootstrap JS)

targets.objective: Test authentication security: SQL injection, brute force attacks, authentication bypass, weak credential validation, and exploitation of exposed test credentials (test:test)
targets.rationale: Critical authentication endpoint with hardcoded test credentials exposed in HTML comments. Represents primary entry point to application. Testing should focus on: (1) SQL injection in username/password fields, (2) bypass of authentication check, (3) brute force attack on password, (4) account enumeration, (5) default credential exploitation.

targets.objective: Test for IDOR vulnerabilities, parameter tampering, authorization bypass, CSRF attacks, and injection vulnerabilities in profile update functionality
targets.rationale: POST endpoint for updating user profile with financial data (loan_amount, loan_term_months, monthly_payment). High-value target due to: (1) Modifiable financial fields with no apparent validation, (2) NO CSRF token present in form, (3) Potential IDOR if user_id can be manipulated, (4) Session-based authorization could be bypassed.

targets.objective: Test for IDOR vulnerabilities, parameter injection, information disclosure, and authentication bypass. Verify term parameter handling and access control
targets.rationale: Endpoint accepts 'term' parameter to generate amortization tables. Feature marked as 'not fully implemented' but accessible. Missing parameter causes 500 error (information disclosure). Risks: (1) SQL/NoSQL injection via term parameter, (2) IDOR if term parameter is linked to user_id/loan_id, (3) Accessing other users' amortization data, (4) Information disclosure via error messages.

targets.objective: Test for XSS vulnerabilities in JavaScript code, IDOR when iframe loads amortization data, and client-side security issues
targets.rationale: Endpoint contains JavaScript that loads /amortization via iframe. Potential vectors: (1) Stored/reflected XSS in loan detail values displayed to user, (2) IDOR when iframe src is constructed with term parameter, (3) Client-side manipulation of term parameter before iframe load, (4) Access to other users' loan data through iframe manipulation.

targets.objective: Test for IDOR vulnerabilities in displaying user information, authorization bypass, and session management weaknesses
targets.rationale: Displays personalized user information (John Doe name visible). Potential for horizontal privilege escalation if: (1) User ID in session can be modified, (2) No server-side validation of user context, (3) Accessible to unauthorized users, (4) Session fixation vulnerabilities.

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] Hardcoded test credentials exposed in HTML comments at /login - Username: test, Password: test - Allows unauthorized access to entire application
[CRITICAL] NO CSRF token present in /profile form - POST endpoint vulnerable to cross-site request forgery attacks on profile updates
[HIGH] /profile endpoint allows modification of sensitive financial data (loan_amount, loan_term_months, monthly_payment) with no apparent validation or rate limiting
[HIGH] /amortization endpoint marked as 'not fully implemented' but still accessible and functional - Missing term parameter causes 500 error revealing internal error handling
[HIGH] Potential IDOR vulnerability in /amortization and /profile endpoints if user context is not properly validated server-side
[MEDIUM] SQL injection risk in login form (/login) username/password fields - No apparent input sanitization visible
[MEDIUM] Session cookie-based authentication with no apparent HTTPS enforcement on localhost (expected for local testing)
[MEDIUM] Lack of input validation on profile form fields could lead to injection attacks or data corruption
[LOW] Verbose error messages from application (404 pages, 500 errors) could aid attackers in reconnaissance
[LOW] jQuery and Bootstrap libraries included - check for known vulnerabilities in versions used
